page.title: 12Preparation for Show:Pateley
page.content: On the evening before the show, my Uncle selects pairs of pork pigs for evenness of size and weight. At 7.30am on show day, they are fed and watered. He arrives at the show by about 9.00am and the pigs are then put into pens. There he washes the pigs with hot water and detergent. Then he rinses them and dries them with a towel. Finally, he dusts them with white sawdust so they look clean. Our cattle are washed thoroughly the day before the show. The next day, if needed, they are given a quick wash and then taken to Pateley. Once at the show ground, the animals are brushed in order to make them look wider and fatter. When our class is called, we lead our animal into the ring for judging. All the cattle are lined up side by side.The judges then look at each animal and decide on a winner.
